title: How to Unarchive an Email on Gmail on iPhone or iPad

steps.title: Open the Gmail app.
steps.content: Open the Gmail app. The app has a white envelope with a multicolored M . If you aren't already logged into your account , tap Sign in to do so now.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . It's at the top-left corner of the screen. The menu will open.

steps.title: Tap All Mail.
steps.content: Tap All Mail . You may have to scroll down a little to find it. This is usually below Drafts .

steps.title: Tap the message you want to unarchive.
steps.content: Tap the message you want to unarchive. The contents of the message will appear. If you want to unarchive multiple emails, tap the sender's profile pictures to select them.

steps.title: Tap ⋯.
steps.content: Tap ⋯ . It's at the top-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Move to Inbox.
steps.content: Tap Move to Inbox . This moves the archived message back to your primary Inbox. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Mail app.
steps.content: Open the Mail app . It's the blue icon with a white envelope. If you have your Gmail added to your iPhone or iPad, you'll see your inbox.

steps.title: Tap Mailboxes.
steps.content: Tap Mailboxes . This is at the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap All Mail.
steps.content: Tap All Mail . If you have multiple emails added to the Mail app, this will be underneath the header for your Gmail address.

steps.title: Tap Edit.
steps.content: Tap Edit . It's at the top-right corner of the screen. It may take a few moments for the button to appear.

steps.title: Select a message to unarchive.
steps.content: Select a message to unarchive. Tap the circle next to the message you want to bring back to the Inbox. A blue check mark will appear to the left of the message. You can select multiple messages to restore by tapping each message's corresponding circle.

steps.title: Tap Move.
steps.content: Tap Move . It's at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Inbox.
steps.content: Tap Inbox . This moves the selected message(s) back into your main mail folder.
